p: According to references consulted, Montanoa plants have been used in traditional medicine for the biocidal and spermicidal activities, to treat reproductive impairments, for its pro-ejaculatory effects and contraceptive activity [ 9, 10], as well as for its aphrodisiac effect [ 11]. In this regard, Montanoa tomentosa is used in traditional herbal medicine to ease childbirth labor and to cure certain female disorders. Crude extracts of M. tomentosa have been reported to have aphrodisiacal effect on male rats. This investigation has pointed out the diterpenes kaurenoic acid, grandiflorenic acid, and monoginoic acid as bioactive molecules showing uterotonic effects [ 12, 13]. Furthermore, the antianxiety effect of M. tomentosa was assessed in rats with different hormonal conditions, and low and high hormone levels. The results showed that M. tomentosa induced dose-dependent anxiolytic-like actions in rats with low hormone level conditions [ 14].
